newsitem.title: ARGENTINA: Argentina's Menem denies Cavallo charges.
newsitem.headline: Argentina's Menem denies Cavallo charges.

text.p: Argentine President Carlos Menem Tuesday dismissed charges by his former Economy Minister Domgino Cavallo that he was led astray by corrupt friends and presidential hangers on.
"I don't know what personal friends he is referring to," Menem told local radio, describing Cavallo's remarks as "hasty".
Menem added, "If it is the case that some people have committed acts of corruption, then those who should judge are the courts."

At a news conference late Monday to announce he wanted to be president, Cavallo said that Menem was being misled by corrupt members of his entourage "who whisper into his ear and call themselves his friends, who have tried to use him to do business for themselves or have done corrupt business."

The president sacked Cavallo in July after a long series of clashes by the minister with traditionalist members of Menem's Peronist Party to opposed to free market policies, and also spectacular accusations of official corruption.
Cavallo returned to politics vowing to crusade against corruption and accused two cabinet ministers of manipulating judges and trying to impede corruption investigations.
